Detailed Description

Port creation configuration structure.

Member Data Documentation

◆ cos_id

dlb_port_cos_ids_t dlb_create_port_t::cos_id

Load-balanced port scheduling class-of-service this port should belong to. Applicable to load-balanced ports only.

If in doubt, select DLB_PORT_COS_ID_ANY.

This field is ignored if the device lacks the port_cos capability.

◆ cq_depth

uint16_t dlb_create_port_t::cq_depth

Depth of the port's consumer queue. Must be a power-of-2 number between 8 and 1024, inclusive.

For load-balanced CQs, smaller CQ depths (8-16) are recommended for best load-balancing. For directed CQs, larger depths (128+) are recommended.

◆ credit_pool_id

uint32_t dlb_create_port_t::credit_pool_id

Credit pool ID

◆ dir_credit_pool_id

uint32_t dlb_create_port_t::dir_credit_pool_id

Directed credit pool ID

◆ is_producer

bool dlb_create_port_t::is_producer

Hint for DLB that the port is being used only for enqueueing. Applicable only for directed ports.

◆ ldb_credit_pool_id

uint32_t dlb_create_port_t::ldb_credit_pool_id

Load-balanced credit pool ID

◆ num_ldb_event_state_entries

uint32_t dlb_create_port_t::num_ldb_event_state_entries

Load-balanced event state storage. Must be a power-of-2 number greater than or equal to the CQ depth. Applicable to load-balanced ports only.

Recommended setting: 2*cq_depth.
